III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/27/24, a youth and some friends walked off facility campus
without staff intervention. They climbed up the roof of a marijuana
grow operation, and a youth climbed up an antenna and
threatened to jump off warranting intervention from emergency
services. Two weeks ago, the same youth walked off the campus
and went into a marijuana grow operation and took a container of
marijuana. A staff restrained the youth and brought the youth back
to campus. Youth walked off campus later that day and required
law enforcement to bring the youth back. There are concerns
regarding supervision.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on November 4,
2024, and reported they had no additional information.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Director reported Youth A had one to one
supervision from October 1 – 26, 2024 and in a unit by himself
until November 5, 2024. Director stated Youth A was taken off his
safety plan on October 26. Director stated when Youth A got into
the marijuana grow building Youth A’s 1:1 staff was with him.
Director reported the door to the marijuana grow building was
unlocked and Youth A was able to open the door and walk into the
building. Director stated staff were with Youth A when this
occurred, and Director responded to assist with the situation.
Director described being surprised the door was unlocked which
allowed Youth A to walk into the grow room.
Director reported Youth A ran away from his 1:1 staff and made it
to the building where the antenna is next to, before staff could
catch Youth A. Director stated staff were notified and ran to catch
up to Youth A. Director reported there are times police will assist
without being contacted. Director stated the police have stopped
to check in with staff when seeing staff walking with a youth in the
community.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility November
6 and 18, 2024. Youth A described being with Staff 1, his 1:1
staff, and getting upset with peers so he ran out of the facility.
2

Youth A stated he ran through a path, off site to a building where
the antenna is located and started to climb up the antenna. Youth
A reported he got to the antenna and climbed about 10 – 15 feet
before Staff 1 arrived. Youth A stated Staff 1 was yelling at him to
stop climbing and to come back down but Youth A stated he kept
climbing up the antenna. Youth A reported he climbed to the top
of the antenna. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 arrived with another
staff (could not recall who the staff was) and then the police
arrived. Youth A denied any other youth being with him when he
climbed the antenna. Youth A reported Staff 1 ran after him, but
Youth A stated he is faster than Staff 1. Youth A stated he
eventually climbed down the ladder and was taken to the hospital
to be evaluated then returned to the facility. Youth A reported the
same day Youth A climbed the antenna, Staff 1 slammed Youth A
into a wooden wall. This incident is being investigated in
2025SIC0000086.
Youth A denied ever being in a marijuana grow operation building
and taking a container of marijuana. The incident was described
to Youth A and Youth A still denied being part of the situation.
Youth A reported walking to the laundromat with Staff 4 following
him the entire time. Youth A stated Staff 4 was talking to Youth A,
but Youth A could not recall what Staff 4 was saying to him.
Youth A denied any other youth or staff being with Youth A and
Staff 4. Youth A described getting to the laundromat and the
police arriving. Youth A reported the police transported Youth A
back to the facility. Youth A could not recall when this incident
took place.
Youth A reported a staff is always with him but if Youth A starts to
run no one can catch him. Youth A described sometimes he just
walks off campus and staff will follow him but “they don’t really do
anything.” Youth A stated sometimes he walks with other youth
from the facility, but he does not know the youths’ names. Youth
A reported staff allow him to walk off the unit but always follow
him. Youth A stated he was on a safety plan but did not know
what was on the plan or why he was on the safety plan.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility November
6, 2024. Staff 2 described when she arrived at the antenna Youth
A was already at the top. Staff 2 reported Youth A was on a
safety plan for exhibiting unsafe behaviors and had a 1:1 until
recently. Staff 2 stated the 1:1 was discontinued by the county so
Youth A was placed in a unit by himself with one staff, which was
basically keeping the 1:1. Staff 2 denied ever seeing Youth A not
3

being supervised by staff. Staff 2 reported she did not have any
concerns with staff supervision.
Staff 2 denied being involved in the situation when Youth A
opened the door to the marijuana grow operation building. Staff 2
stated she heard about it but was not involved.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 was Youth A’s
1:1 staff when Youth A climbed up the antenna by the old Human
Resources building. Supervisor 1 stated he arrived at the building
after Youth A was at the top of the antenna. Supervisor 1
described the police arrived to assist along with many other staff.
Supervisor 1 denied having concerns with staff supervision.
Supervisor 1 reported staff encourage Youth A to use his
identified coping skills and verbally redirect Youth A when he
wants to leave the facility.
Supervisor 1 reported he was not involved when Youth A walked
into the marijuana grow operation building. Supervisor 1 stated if
any youth walks off the unit staff follow the youth and call for
assistance. Supervisor 1 reported staff cannot prevent a youth
from walking out of the unit so staff must follow the youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Youth B reported staff supervise the youth
all the time. Youth B stated staff will try and stand in front of the
doors but if a youth wants to leave the staff has to move away
from the door. Youth B reported if a youth leaves the building a
staff will follow the youth and call a supervisor. Youth B described
Youth A as “really annoying.” Youth B stated a staff is always with
Youth A. Youth B denied ever walking out of the building and
going anywhere with Youth A. Youth B reported he heard about
Youth A climbing to the top of the antenna because Youth A
“always talks about it.” Youth B reported Youth A said Staff 1 was
with him but could not stop Youth A from getting to the antenna
because Youth A was faster than Staff 1.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Youth C reported staff supervise all the time.
Youth C stated staff, and a supervisor will follow youth if youth
leave the building. Youth C was asked if he ever left the facility
with Youth A and Youth C stated, “my eyes don’t work all the time,
it’s not my business to share.” Youth C reported he was not going
to talk about any youth at the facility because it is not Youth C’s
4

business. Youth C denied having any concerns with staff
supervision.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Youth D reported staff always supervise
youth. Youth D described if a youth walks out of the building staff
follow the youth and call for assistance. Youth D denied ever
leaving the building and going anywhere with Youth A. Youth D
stated staff are “always” with Youth A. Youth D reported Youth A
has a 1:1 staff so staff must follow Youth A everywhere Youth A
goes. Youth D denied seeing Youth A climb an antenna or enter a
private property building.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Staff 3 reported when she arrived at the
antenna Youth A was already at the top. Staff 3 stated Staff 1
was Youth A’s 1:1 that day. Staff 3 denied ever seeing Youth A
not being supervised by Staff 1. Staff 3 reported if Youth A walks
out of the building staff will try and verbally redirect Youth A back
to the building or call for assistance if Youth A is not following
direction. Staff 3 stated the police, and the fire department helped
get Youth A down from the antenna then brought Youth A back to
the facility.
Staff 3 stated she assisted Staff 1 the day Youth A walked into the
marijuana grow building. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was with Youth A
the entire time. Staff 3 described seeing Youth A walk toward the
marijuana grown building with Staff 1 walking with Youth A. Staff
3 reported she was in the field with Youth D who was struggling to
follow direction and return to the facility. Staff 3 stated she saw
Youth A trying to open the doors of the building when one of the
doors opened and Youth A entered the building. Staff 3 reported
she called Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 2, and Director arrived to
assist. Staff 3 stated she was shocked one of doors was unlocked
to the building.
Staff 3 reported Youth A had been on a 1:1, then was placed in a
unit by himself which maintained his 1:1 staffing. Staff 3 stated if
a youth leaves the facility staff follow the youth and call for
assistance. Staff 3 denied ever seeing Youth A without a staff
with him.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 6, 2024. Supervisor 2 reported she called the police
when Youth A climbed up the antenna. Supervisor 2 stated she
was contacted by Staff 1 when Youth A ran out of the facility.
5

Supervisor 2 denied having concerns Staff 1 was not supervising
Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported she did not recall any other youth
being at the building or on the antenna. Supervisor 2 stated the
police and fire department arrived to assist and was able to get
Youth A down from the antenna.
Supervisor 2 reported Youth A walks out of the facility frequently
and sometimes staff can talk Youth A into returning and
sometimes Youth A does not listen and continues to walk off.
Supervisor 2 stated when Youth A continues to walk off staff
follow Youth A and call for assistance. Supervisor 2 denied Youth
A not being supervised. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was on a
1:1 and when the county discontinued the 1:1, Youth A was
placed in a unit by himself so would basically still have 1:1
staffing.
Supervisor 2 stated she was contacted by Staff 3 the day Youth A
entered the marijuana grow operation through an unlocked door.
Supervisor 2 stated Staff 1 and Staff 3 were with Youth A in the
marijuana room when Director and Supervisor 2 arrived at the
building. Supervisor 2 described multiple bags of marijuana being
everywhere in the room and Youth A grabbing a bag and putting it
down his pants. Supervisor 2 stated it was a scary situation
because they were on private property, it was a small tight space,
and it was a marijuana grow building. Supervisor 2 reported when
Youth A left the facility Staff 1 was with Youth A. Supervisor 2
denied being aware of Youth A not being supervised.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on November 7, 2024.
Staff 1 stated he was assigned as Youth A’s 1:1 staff the day
Youth A climbed the antenna. Staff 1 described Youth A getting
upset because some of the youths were saying things to Youth A,
so Youth A walked off the unit and out the building. Staff 1
reported he followed Youth A, used redirection and talked to
Youth A trying to convince Youth A to return to the facility. Staff 1
stated Youth A refused to return to the facility and ran through the
path to the old Human Resource building and climbed the
antenna. Staff 1 reported he ran after Youth A, but Youth A got to
the antenna before Staff 1. Staff 1 described calling for
assistance when Youth A ran through the path. Staff 1 stated he
could not recall who he called but stated it would have been a
supervisor. Staff 1 denied not supervising Youth A.
Staff 1 stated he was with Youth A when Youth A entered the
marijuana grow operation through an unlocked door. Staff 1
reported he was out for a walk with Youth A when Youth A went
6

over to the building and started to try and open the doors. Staff 1
stated Youth A was not escalated or upset when they were
walking, they “literally were just out for a walk.” Staff 1 reported
he used verbal redirection, was attempting to get in-between
Youth A and the doors but was unsuccessful. Staff 1 stated one
of the doors actually opened and Youth A walked into the room.
Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was nearby with Youth D and could see
what was happening. Staff 1 described marijuana being in large
bags all around the room and in a large bowl. Staff 1 denied not
supervising Youth A when Youth A entered the marijuana grow
building.
Staff 1 stated Youth A walks off the unit frequently. Staff 1
reported there is never a time he is aware of when Youth A is not
supervised by staff. Staff 1 descried being assigned Youth A’s 1:1
several times and many days there are no issues with Youth A.
Staff 1 reported having a good relationship with Youth A and many
times has been able to redirect Youth A back into the facility.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Staff 4 described following Youth A to the
laundromat when Youth A walked off the unit and left the facility.
Staff 4 stated he talked with Youth A trying to get him to return to
the facility, but Youth A refused redirection. Staff 4 reported Youth
A was not escalated, not making any self-harming comments, but
would not follow direction to return to the facility. Staff 4 stated the
police arrived while Staff 4 was following Youth A. Staff 4 denied
calling the police for assistance. Staff 4 reported he contacted
whoever the supervisor was that day to report Youth A walking off
site. Staff 4 denied ever seeing Youth A without staff supervision.
Documents Reviewed:
• One on One staffing invoice for Youth A to Wayne County
from 10/01/2024 – 10/26/2024.
• Documented 1:1 for Youth A listing dates Youth A on 1:1
and showing 1:1 discontinued on 10/26/24 at 7:44am.
• Incident Report dated 10/24/2024 describing Youth A
climbing up the antenna tower. Incident report consistent
with Youth A and staff interviews.
• Incident Report dated 10/22/2024 describing Youth A
entering a marijuana grow building. Incident report consist
with Youth A and staff interviews.
• Protocols for Staff Supervising Client Policy. Policy states,
program staff is to maintain adequate supervision coverage
and “line of sight” of all clients when in direct supervision of
clients. Within line of sight means that it is possible to
7

reasonably visually distinguish and recognize individuals.
Any additional measures of supervision of a client will be
noted in their individual service plan or through emergency
protocols, depending on the presenting behaviors and/or
mental health of the youth.
• Safety Plan dated 10/18/2024 for Youth A indicating Youth
A’s triggers, warning signs that he may become unsafe,
what unsafe behaviors could look like, things Youth A could
do to help himself, things staff can do to help Youth A, and
restrictions for Youth A.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews staff are supervising and following Youth A when Youth
A leaves the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
